alert.note: Alert for Coal; Johnston; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 15 at 6:38PM CDT until May 15 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Western Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 638 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fittstown, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ada, Stonewall, Tupelo, Bromide, Centrahoma, Pontotoc, Fittstown, Clarita and Jesse. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
